This is supported by the fact that the humeral head is palpated below the coracoid process, which suggests that it has moved forward and downward. Arthrography studies suggest that in anterior dislocations, the most frequent abnormality identified is an enlarged but intact shoulder capsule, and shoulder joint capsular tears or disruptions are seen in 48% of patients. Ruptures of the rotator cuff occur more frequently in initial dislocations (62%) than in recurrent ones (36%).

The brachial plexus supplies sensation to various skin areas including the medial aspect of the upper arm, lateral aspect of the shoulder, and dorsal aspect of the forearm and hand.
